caption: Letang on Dupuis:  He s always been there for me since the day he joined the team. He s been a (role) model, older-guy that I looked at. He s a great guy in the dressing room. Everybody loves him. He s one of our big leaders.
caption_raw: Letang on Dupuis: “He’s always been there for me since the day he joined the team. He’s been a (role) model, older-guy that I looked at. He’s a great guy in the dressing room. Everybody loves him. He’s one of our big leaders.”

caption: Kunitz on Dupuis:  The locker room is where you really miss him. The guy on the planes and hanging out at dinners and making fun of situations when we re not feeling as confident as we need to as a group. I think that s the friendship part of what Duper brings to the team and the leadership stuff.
caption_raw: Kunitz on Dupuis: “The locker room is where you really miss him. The guy on the planes and hanging out at dinners and making fun of situations when we’re not feeling as confident as we need to as a group. I think that’s the friendship part of what Duper brings to the team and the leadership stuff.”

caption: Dupuis: "It s not a great situation to be in, but that s the card I ve been dealt. Hockey is definitely second on my mind right now. My family at home are the most important point in my life right now. Just gotta be healthy for them.
caption_raw: Dupuis: "It’s not a great situation to be in, but that’s the card I’ve been dealt. Hockey is definitely second on my mind right now. My family at home are the most important point in my life right now. Just gotta be healthy for them.”

caption: Bob Scuderi, on seeing his son fall in love with the game of hockey:  Everybody had a lot of money, but we really didn t have that much. So when they had to get new pants or a helmet, I would have to spray paint them the color they needed to be rather than buy a new pair. I bought the boys some old-time skates and I figured if they didn t like them, they wouldn t play anymore and you know what? They played and they loved the game.
caption_raw: Bob Scuderi, on seeing his son fall in love with the game of hockey: “Everybody had a lot of money, but we really didn’t have that much. So when they had to get new pants or a helmet, I would have to spray paint them the color they needed to be rather than buy a new pair. I bought the boys some old-time skates and I figured if they didn’t like them, they wouldn’t play anymore and you know what? They played and they loved the game.”

caption: Steigerwald on Lemieux:  It s one thing to draft a great player, and you can have hopes that he ll lead you to the Promised Land   but no one ever in their wildest imagination could have seen what was coming in terms of the profile he would have and the impact he would on this franchise for as long as he s had it. And then to end up being the owner, it s just not something any of us would have postulated.  #30YearsOf66
caption_raw: Steigerwald on Lemieux: “It’s one thing to draft a great player, and you can have hopes that he’ll lead you to the Promised Land – but no one ever in their wildest imagination could have seen what was coming in terms of the profile he would have and the impact he would on this franchise for as long as he’s had it. And then to end up being the owner, it’s just not something any of us would have postulated.” #30YearsOf66

caption: On June 9, 1984 the #Pens selected 18-year-old Montreal, Quebec native, Mario Lemieux, with the first overall pick in the NHL Draft. On that day, exactly thirty years ago, the Pittsburgh Penguins franchise changed forever. #30YearsOf66

caption: Bill Guerin:  It takes everybody. That s what we have to get back to. Everybody on the same page, being able to buy in and believe.
caption_raw: Bill Guerin: “It takes everybody. That’s what we have to get back to. Everybody on the same page, being able to buy in and believe.”

caption:
Jim Rutherford has been named General Manager of the Pittsburgh Penguins, it was announced today by co-owners Mario Lemieux and Ron Burkle. 
Rutherford:  To have the chance to work with Sidney Crosby, Evgeni Malkin and the talented group of players assembled here is something that any GM would dream of. I m looking forward to getting to work right away   it s going to be an important summer.  Jason Botterill has been promoted to Associate GM. Bill Guerin and Tom Fitzgerald will serve as the #Pens Assistant GMs.

Dan Bylsma has been relieved of his duties as Head Coach.
caption_raw:
Jim Rutherford has been named General Manager of the Pittsburgh Penguins, it was announced today by co-owners Mario Lemieux and Ron Burkle. 
Rutherford: “To have the chance to work with Sidney Crosby, Evgeni Malkin and the talented group of players assembled here is something that any GM would dream of. I’m looking forward to getting to work right away – it’s going to be an important summer.” Jason Botterill has been promoted to Associate GM. Bill Guerin and Tom Fitzgerald will serve as the #Pens Assistant GMs.

Dan Bylsma has been relieved of his duties as Head Coach.

caption: Steve Yzerman on Chris Kunitz: "He's played extremely well, he's a hard-nosed player. Yes, he plays with Sidney Crosby and he's been a great contributor not only to that line but to his team, whether it be 5-on-5 or the power play. So the question that I think a lot of people have asked is, is Chris Kunitz being helped by Sidney Crosby? They help each other and he's a tremendous player and ultimately, we asked ourselves the question, on his own, does he belong on this team? And our answer was yes, he belongs on this team."
caption_raw: Steve Yzerman on Chris Kunitz: "He's played extremely well, he's a hard-nosed player. Yes, he plays with Sidney Crosby and he's been a great contributor not only to that line but to his team, whether it be 5-on-5 or the power play. So the question that I think a lot of people have asked is, is Chris Kunitz being helped by Sidney Crosby? They help each other and he's a tremendous player and ultimately, we asked ourselves the question, on his own, does he belong on this team? And our answer was yes, he belongs on this team."

Join the Penguins and our partners as we raise money for our  Support Our Heroes  campaign! Make a donation at your local First Niagara branch, Dunkin  Donuts Western, PA location, or CONSOL Energy Center to support this worthy cause. 
Monies generated will go to support our real heroes, the Veterans who serve us proudly, through charitable programs at: - Operation Troop Appreciation - Austin s Military Playroom Project - Pittsburgh Penguins Foundation   Mighty Penguins Sled Hockey Program 
Proudly supported by ATI, Dunkin  Donuts and First Niagara.

Join the Penguins and our partners as we raise money for our “Support Our Heroes” campaign! Make a donation at your local First Niagara branch, Dunkin’ Donuts Western, PA location, or CONSOL Energy Center to support this worthy cause. 
Monies generated will go to support our real heroes, the Veterans who serve us proudly, through charitable programs at: - Operation Troop Appreciation - Austin’s Military Playroom Project - Pittsburgh Penguins Foundation – Mighty Penguins Sled Hockey Program 
Proudly supported by ATI, Dunkin’ Donuts and First Niagara.
